ARABIC: أَمْ يَقُولُونَ بِهِۦ جِنَّةٌۢ بَلْ جَآءَهُم بِٱلْحَقِّ وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ لِلْحَقِّ كَٰرِهُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Or do they say, 'He is a man possessed,' when he has brought the truth to them? But most of them hate the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Or do they say that he is possessed? In fact, he has brought the truth to them, but most of them abhor the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Or do they say that there is madness in him? Nay, he has brought them the Truth and it is the Truth that most of them disdain.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: or you said that he is possessed by satan? In fact, he has brought you the truth, but most of you dislike it.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Or they say, “He is afflicted by a demon”; in fact he brought the Truth to them, and most of them dislike the Truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Or they say: There is madness in him Nay, but he brought them the truth, but most of them are averse to the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Or do they say: There is madness in him? Nay! he has brought them the truth, and most of them are averse from the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Or do they say, 'He is bedevilled'? Nay, he has brought them the truth, but most of them are averse from the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Or say they: There is a madness in him? Nay, but he bringeth them the Truth; and most of them are haters of the Truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Do they say he is possessed? Rather he has brought them the truth, but most of them are averse to the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Or, say they: in him is madness? O Aye he brought them the truth, and most of them to the truth are averse.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Do they say, ‘There is madness in him’? No, he has brought them the truth, and most of them are averse to the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Or do they say, "He is possessed"? Nay, he has brought them the Truth, but most of them hate the Truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Or say they: "There is madness in him?" Nay, but he brought them the truth [i.e. "(A) Tauhid: Worshipping Allah Alone in all aspects (B) The Quran (C) The religion of Islam,"] but most of them (the disbelievers) are averse to the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Do they say he is mad! No, he came to them with the truth, but most of them hate the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Or do they say, “He is possessed?” In fact, he brought them the truth, but most of them hate the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Or do they say, "In him is madness?" Rather, he brought them the truth, but most of them, to the truth, are averse.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [23:70] Or do they say, ‘There is a madness in him’? — this interrogative is meant as an affirmation of the truth of the Prophet’s sincerity, and [of the fact] that messengers did come to past communities, and [of the fact] that they [do indeed] recognise their Messenger to be truthful and trustworthy, and [of the fact] that there is no madness in him. Nay (bal is for transition), he has brought them the truth, namely, the Qur’ān that comprises [affirmations of] the Oneness [of God] and the Laws of Islam; but most of them are averse to the truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Or say they) indeed they say: (There is a madness in him? Nay, but he bringeth them the Truth) Muhammad (pbuh) brought them the Qur'an, the profession of Allah's divine Oneness and the Message; (and most of them are haters) deniers (of the Truth) of the Qur'an.
